column4: Hello.  I'm using 11.10 on an Asus G50V laptop.  I have my BIOS thermal management turned on.  I'm exhibiting temperatures between 54 and 58 celsius.  Although this is a gaming laptop, and I would expect it to run hotter than a smaller unit, these temps seem a tad high.  I've tried fancontrol with no luck.  Is there any other way to increase fan speed?
what problems did you have with fancontrol?
Here's a paste of when I do:  sudo pwmconfig  -- http://paste.ubuntu.com/723927/
You may need to enable a kernel module for the type of sensors you have.  Does sensors-detect come up with anything?
I'll do that and paste it
Here's my output of:  sudo sensors-detect -- http://paste.ubuntu.com/723929/
now either run the service command at the bottom of that or reboot, then run pwmconfig again.
which service?  fancontrol?
'service module-init-tools start'
line 116
I get this:  sudo service module-init-tools start -- module-init-tools stop/waiting
Any suggestions about my fan issue?
What did pwmconfig say after you loaded the modules?  You never posted that I don't think.
that was meant for you
It says stop/waiting.  Should I do the pwmconfig anyway?  I interpret that at it saying that it's stopped.
Yes, do pwmconfig.
sudo pwmconfig output:   .../usr/sbin/pwmconfig: There are no pwm-capable sensor modules installed
well that's too bad.  It's possible your motherboard just doesn't support fan speed controls.
Weird.  My BIOS has digital thermal management capability, and it's enabled.  It wasn't, initially, so I enabled it.  The BIOS may just have it, and the board may not.
I'm tired of these asus/best buy hobbled-down puters.  I'm buying the real mccoy next time.
well, thank you for your help.  I do appreciate it at any rate. :)
